lead_paragraph: MacINTYRE-ROSS--Clare Alden, of Falls Church, VA, and formerly of New York City and Scarsdale, NY, died March 9, 2016 at age 73 under palliative care at INOVA Fairfax Hospital as a result of complications from a stroke. Clare was born in Washington, DC to the late Mr. and Mrs. Malcolm A. MacIntyre and survived by David A. Ross, her husband of 26 years, who is a Washington lawyer and retired Lieutenant Colonel in the Army Reserves, her sister Pamela MacIntyre and her husband Robert Sawrey, and nephews Duncan and Gordon MacIntyre, the sons of the late Bruce MacIntyre. During the 1970's and 1980's, Clare worked on Wall Street, initially at Drexel Burnham Lambert as its first female institutional salesman, and then at Citibank as an account officer in the International Services Division for Latin America. Previously, she was involved in the musical and song-writing career of the late Harry Chapin and is considered the inspiration for his 1972 song "Taxi." A complete obituary and space for on-line memorials to Clare can be found at: moneyandking.com. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MACINTYRE, ROSS, CLARE ALDEN
